results.title: Cafe
results.brief_description: This first film of writer, actor, director Craig Hoogendoorn, revolves around the cafe conversations of three groups of people - the lovers in the midst of a breakup, the male whining to the female about his ex-girlfriend’s behaviour and the three friends celebrating single life. Shot in black and white the camera plays back and forth between the three groups, catching their conversations in mid-flight. Witty and technically faultless, the film is a promising debut for this young Canberra based filmmaker.

results.title: Cadet worlds: Portugal, 1974
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Two helmsmen from Tasmania were selected to represent Australia in the 1974 ‘cadet’ Dinghy World Championships. Beginning with the Tasmanian crews mid-winter training at the Sandy Bay Sailing Club in Hobart, the action culminates in the competitions sailed in Portugal.

results.title: Cadet Rousselle
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge, ONF | NFB and George Dunning
results.brief_description: Animated puppets illustrate the old French satirical song about Cadet Rousselle, ostentatious, affected, the clown of the period between the French Revolution and the military order of Napoleon. Cadet Rousselle falls down a ladder, trips on battlements, even his dogs will not obey him. Animation: George Dunning, Colin Low Award: Gardone

results.title: Cadet Rousselle
results.brief_description:
In love with the mayor’s daughter, Cadet-Rousselle is separated from his love by money and by low-born parentage. Thus, he heads to Paris to find fame and fortune and make himself worthy of his sweetheart. En route Cadet-Rousselle gets mixed up with a band of gypsies who plan to help the Royalists topple the new French Republic. Adventure piles upon adventure as Rousselle narrowly escapes death at every turn. With him all the way is the new love of his life, fiery gypsy lass Violetta.

Credits: Producer, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Jean-Paul Lacroix ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Francois Perier, Dany Robin, Bourvil, Christine Carrere, Madeleine Lebeau, Alfred Adam, Jacques Dufilho.

results.title: Caddie
results.brief_description: Caddie (Helen Morse) is a young woman who leaves her husband, taking the children with her. The film traces her struggle to survive during the depression. Based on a real life anonymous autobiography of a young woman who took a job as a barmaid to support her two children.

results.title: Cabin fever
results.creator_credit: ICON, Black Sky Entertainment, Deer Path Films, Sam Froelich, Evan Astrowsky, Lauren Moews and Eli Roth
results.brief_description: Written, directed and produced by Eli Roth, “Cabin Fever” is about a group of five friends who happily set out for a holiday adventure in a cabin in the woods. All seems fine until one of them gets sick with a gross flesh-eating virus. So scary it’s funny, this gory film is written to graphically shock you as opposed to keeping you in suspense, it even comes with a director’s warning at the beginning! Cast includes Jordan Ladd, James DeBello, Rider Strong, Joey Kern and Cerina Vincent. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Cabbie of the year
results.creator_credit: Scottie Connolly, Film Victoria and Mick Connolly
results.brief_description: Bobs luck changes when he mistakenly becomes a Taxi Driver of the Year finalist. As he performs his PR duties with unusual success, he starts to feel just a little impressive - impressive enough to make a move on Kaz, the base secretary hes been secretly admiring for two years. Unfortunately before he manages to ask her out, he is disqualified from the competition in well publicised disgrace. His impressiveness in tatters Bob must decide whether or not to go for Kaz anyway.

results.title: Cabbage root fly
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of this insect which has become a serious pest in Europe and America, the larvae attacking cruciferous plants such as the cabbage and cauliflower.

results.title: Cabaret
results.creator_credit: Cy Feuer, ABC Pictures (US), Allied Artists Pictures and Bob Fosse
results.brief_description: One of the most acclaimed Broadway musicals of all time is brought to the screen with the aid of the brilliant and electrifying Liza Minnelli. For entertainment as its very best you can’t go past “Cabaret” - a scintillating musical with pure gold of human drama beneath its surface glitter. A one-of-a kind musical. Based on Christopher Isherwood’s Berlin stories.
